description: It works perfectly, but it needs an update asap. Clients are saying the server will be out of date soon.
summary: It's great! BUT it needs an update soon!

description:
it Works great on debian but doesn't on arch, idk why or of the problem is in my system but what i get that:

summary: Works on debian but doesn't on arch

description: Run all commands given in summry, it works perfectly. Combined with tailscale, this service is far superior to plex.

This is perfect for someone who is not too comfortable with terminal and yet want to use linux for daily tasks. After trying jellyfin from rpm,.deb package etc, i find the flathub version to be easiest for people like me who just have a normal pc with intel graphics only. It works wonders. Using gnome tweaks i add it to "startup application list" and it just starts up everytime i boot. Version on flathub is getting outdated. My tv is giving me warning to update server. Sooner or later other apps wil drop support too, like infuse on my iphone/ipad. So many people want to move away from windows enclosed world to open world and they definitely not wanna stumble upon plex pass system. So just let us live freely and update this damm app.

Works great!

The jellyfin server flatpak opening the browser on startup can be disabled by using this flag:
flatpak run --command=jellyfin org.jellyfin.JellyfinServer

In my case I modified the Exec line in my org.jellyfin.JellyfinServer.desktop in ~/.config/autostart to be like this:
Exec=/usr/bin/flatpak run --branch=stable --arch=x86_64 --command=jellyfin

What is going on? Install via flatpack, web page comes up, can add media all good there. Then there is just no service running for jellyfin at all, cant enable it (service does not exist) and from there each forum throws random file locations to hunt through, none seem to be correct for opensuse or any rpm distros. Good lord its enough to jusst pay the useage fee for plex.

Works perfectly fine for me. Not sure why the other guy has problems. Probably due to not knowing that Jellyfin from Flatpak needs to be started like an application instead of a systemd service. Make it autostart with your desktop environment's autostart settings

I am using Jellyfin as a foss substitution over Plex for home streaming, and it works almost flawless.

One problem that I found was when resuming a movie it will stream ok for 20-30s then it will studder. No matter what I tried I cannot fix this issue for more than a year.

Overall it's great, except for that one bug.
